title: Singular value
summary: In mathematics, in particular functional analysis, the singular values, or s-numbers of a compact operator T : X → Y {\displaystyle T:X\rightarrow Y} acting between Hilbert spaces X {\displaystyle X} and Y {\displaystyle Y} , are the square roots of the (necessarily non-negative) eigenvalues of the self-adjoint operator T ∗ T {\displaystyle T^{*}T} (where T ∗ {\displaystyle T^{*}} denotes the adjoint of T {\displaystyle T} ).
